stem: A posterior hip dislocation injures the sciatic nerve. Which deficit is most expected?

choices.A: Weak knee extension from quadriceps paralysis
choices.B: Weak hip adduction from adductor paralysis
choices.C: Weak knee flexion due to hamstring involvement
choices.D: Weak hip abduction from gluteus medius paralysis
choices.E: Weak ankle inversion from tibialis anterior paralysis

rationale_correct: Sciatic nerve innervates hamstrings (via tibial component) and all leg/foot muscles; proximal injury weakens knee flexion.

rationale_distractors.D: Hip abductors are superior gluteal nerve.
rationale_distractors.E: Tibialis anterior is deep fibular; may be affected distally but the hallmark proximal finding is hamstring weakness.
